details:
Several vulnerabilities were discovered in dwarfutils, a tool and
library for reading/consuming and writing/producing DWARF debugging
information. The Common Vulnerabilities and Exposures project
identifies the following issues:


* [CVE-2015-8538](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-8538)
A specially crafted ELF file can cause a segmentation fault.
* [CVE-2015-8750](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2015-8750)
A specially crafted ELF file can cause a NULL pointer
 dereference.
* [CVE-2016-2050](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2050)
Out-of-bounds write
* [CVE-2016-2091](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-2091)
Out-of-bounds read
* [CVE-2016-5034](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-5034)
Out-of-bounds write
* [CVE-2016-5036](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-5036)
Out-of-bounds read
* [CVE-2016-5038](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-5038)
Out-of-bounds read
* [CVE-2016-5039](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-5039)
Out-of-bounds read
* [CVE-2016-5042](https://security-tracker.debian.org/tracker/CVE-2016-5042)
A specially crafted DWARF section can cause an infinite loop,
 reading from increasing memory addresses until the application
 crashes.


For Debian 7 Wheezy, these problems have been fixed in version
20120410-2+deb7u2.


We recommend that you upgrade your dwarfutils packages.


Further information about Debian LTS security advisories, how to apply
these updates to your system and frequently asked questions can be
found at: <https://wiki.debian.org/LTS>
